Profile.MakeDefaultHelp:
Make Default
Hold ctrl to make default for the current character
ctrl+shift to remove it as default for the current character
Profile.DeleteHelp:
Delete Config
Hold ctrl to enable
Profile.BareProfileNote: The bare profile is for just running a duty, and nothing else. You can duplicate it to make edits.

Overlay.ShowOverlayHelp:
Note that the quickaction buttons (TurnIn/Desynth/etc) require their respective configs to be enabled!
Or Override Overlay Buttons to be Enabled
Overlay.OverrideButtonsHelp:
Overlay buttons by default are enabled if their config is enabled
This will allow you to chose which buttons are enabled

Duty.AutoLeaveDuty: Auto Leave Duty in last loop
Duty.AutoLeaveDutyHelp: Will automatically exit the dungeon upon completion of the path.
Duty.BlockLeavingDuty: Block leaving duty until it's complete
Duty.AutoManageRotationHelp: Autoduty will enable the Rotation Plugin at the start of each duty\n*AutoDuty will try to use them in list order

Wrath.AutoSetupJobsHelp: If this is not enabled and a job is not setup in Wrath Combo, AD will instead use RSR or bm AutoRotation

Duty.AutoManageBMAIHelp: Autoduty will enable BMAI and any options you configure at the start of each duty.

BMAI.MaxDistanceRoleBased: Set Max Distance To Target Based on Player Role
BMAI.PositionalRoleBased: Set Positional Based on Player Role
BMAI.UseDefaultSettingsHelp: Clicking this will reset your BMAI config to the default and *recommended* settings for AD

Duty.AutoManageVnavCameraHelp: Autoduty will enable AlignCamera in VNav at the start of each duty, and disable it when done if it was not set.
Duty.LootBossTreasureOnlyHelp: AutoDuty will walk around non-boss chests, and only loot boss chests.\nNot all paths may accomodate.
Duty.MinStuckTime: Minimum time before declared stuck (in ms)
Duty.ResetStuckOnStep: Reset stuck counter only on next step

W2W.TreatUnsyncAsW2WHelp: Only works in paths with W2W tags on steps

Duty.OverridePartyValidationHelp: AutoDuty will ignore your party makeup when queueing for duties\nThis is for Multi-Boxing Only\n*AutoDuty is not recommended to be used with other players*

Advanced.UsingAltRotationHelp: You are deciding to use a plugin other than Wrath Combo, Rotation Solver or BossMod AutoRotation.
Advanced.UsingAltMovementHelp: You are deciding to use a plugin other than Vnavmesh.
Advanced.UsingAltBossHelp: You are deciding to use a plugin other than BossMod.

PreLoop.ExecuteCommands: Execute commands on start of all loops
PreLoop.BetweenLoopNote: The following are also done between loop, if Between Loop is enabled (currently {0})
PreLoop.HomePathHelp: For most houses where the door is a straight shot from teleport location this is not needed, in the rare situations where the door needs a path to get to it, you can create that path here, or if your door seems to be further away from the teleport location than your neighbors, simply goto your door and hit Add Current Position
PreLoop.GearSourceHelp: Vanilla - Uses Gear from Armory Chest Only\nGearsetter - Asks gearsetter, can move old items to inventory\nStylist - Uses your stylist settings
PreLoop.MoveOldToInventoryHelp: Except for weapons, this will move the gear to be replaced to the inventory.
PreLoop.RequiresGearsetterOrStylist: * Items outside the armoury chest requires Gearsetter or Stylist plugin
PreLoop.SelfHelp: Will use DarkMatter to Self Repair (Requires Leveled Crafters!)
PreLoop.CityNpcHelp: Will use preferred repair npc to repair.
PreLoop.PreferredRepairNPCHelp: It's a good idea to match the Repair NPC with Summoning Bell and if possible Retire Location
PreLoop.AutoConsumeHelp: AutoDuty will consume these items on run and between each loop (if status does not exist)
PreLoop.IgnoreStatusHelp: AutoDuty will consume these items on run and between each loop every time (even if status does exists)
PreLoop.MinTimeRemainingHelp: If the status has less than this amount of time remaining (in minutes), it will consume these items
PreLoop.ItemNameHint: Start typing item name to search

BetweenLoop.WaitTimeHelp: Will delay all AutoDuty between-loop Processes for X seconds.
BetweenLoop.ExecuteCommands: Execute commands in between of all loops
BetweenLoop.AutoOpenCoffersHelp: AutoDuty will open gear coffers (like paladin arms) between each loop
BetweenLoop.UseBlacklistHelp: Option to disable some coffers from being opened automatically.
BetweenLoop.CofferNameHint: Start typing coffer name to search
BetweenLoop.ItemLevelLimitHelp: Stops desynthesising an item once your desynthesis skill reaches the Item Level + this limit.
BetweenLoop.PreferredSummoningBellHelp: No matter what location is chosen, if there is a summoning bell in the location you are in when this is invoked it will go there instead

Termination.StopAtLevelHelp: Looping will stop when these conditions are reached, so long as an adequate number of loops have been allocated.
Termination.StopNoRestedXPHelp: Looping will stop when these conditions are reached, so long as an adequate number of loops have been allocated.
Termination.StopAtItemQty: Stop Looping When Reach Item Qty
Termination.StopAtItemQtyHelp: Looping will stop when these conditions are reached, so long as an adequate number of loops have been allocated.
Termination.ItemNameHint: Start typing item name to search
Termination.StopOnlyWhenAllItems: Stop Looping Only When All Items Obtained
Termination.StopBLUSpell: Stop Looping when BLU spell unlocked
Termination.StopOnlyWhenAllSpells: Stop Looping Only When All Spells Unlocked
Termination.ExecuteCommandsOnTermination: Execute commands on termination of all loops
Termination.PlaySoundOnCompletion: Play Sound on Completion of All Loops:

Multiboxing.Step1: Step 1: Have 4 clients logged in and ready with AD open on the same data center not in a party
Multiboxing.Step2: Step 2: One of the clients becomes the host. The host will lead the others. Select host below on the client you want to become host
Multiboxing.Step3: Step 3: Select if you want to use Named Pipes or TCP to connect. While both works in either case, Pipes are recommended when all clients are on the same pc. TCP if not.
Multiboxing.Step4Pipes: Step 4: The pipe name needs to match between clients and host
Multiboxing.Step5Pipes: Step 5: On the clients, the server name can be used to connect to hosts on other computers. The default of "." is the local computer.
Multiboxing.Step4TCP: Step 4: The port needs to match between clients and host
Multiboxing.Step5TCP: Step 5: On the clients, the server address can be changed to connect to hosts on other computers.
Multiboxing.UACWarning: UAC might ask you to allow network access
Multiboxing.Step6: Step 6: Select Multibox on the host
Multiboxing.Step7: Step 7: Select Multibox on the 3 clients. Each of them should be invited to the party. Below will be current information about them. if it says "no info" they are not connected
Multiboxing.Step8: Step 8: On the host, select which dungeon you want to run and how often. Click run
Multiboxing.TransportTypeHelp: Named Pipe: Network connectivity depends on system settings.\nTCP: Network connectivity depends on firewall settings.\nIn most cases Named Pipe should work with no changes.
Multiboxing.SynchronizePathsHelp: Sends the path from the host to the clients
Multiboxing.Name: Name
